fork_status_and_schedule.highlight: BPO fork on Holesky tonight, Sepolia tomorrow; smooth progress expected
MEVBoost v1.10 Alpha 6 released with V1 API fallback support
Named forks (Osaka, Amsterdam) removed from BPO genesis.json - CL side doesn't change

testing_progress.highlight: Stateful gas testing: 3 EL clients running on BloatNet; Nethermind shows variability
Performance doesn't match mainnet observations; investigating caching and hardware factors
Block-level access list tests: Besu 89%, Reth 74%, Geth 71%, Nethermind 70%
EPBS DevNet Zero delayed past October; off-protocol payments discussion blocking progress

rpc_standardization_discussion.highlight: RPC layer has only 190 tests; clients swallow logs causing critical failures
No consensus on RPC behavior (e.g., getLogs limits); clients made individual choices
RPC specs exist in YAML but Geth generates test vectors; clients often fail tests
Client teams need to attend RPC calls; path from consensus to merged spec unclear

action_items.action: Update Sepolia validators to MEVBoost v1.10 Alpha 6
Report worst-case RPC scenarios to execution-specs team for benchmark suite
Attend RPC standardization calls to reach consensus on behavior

decisions.decision: Remove named forks (Osaka, Amsterdam) from BPO genesis schedule when CL values unchanged
